result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin L. Cote was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with Count 3 in 22CF220 and Count 2 in 22CF202

records.addlTxt:
Count 1:  Sentence Withheld and Placed on Probation
Count 2:  Dismissed and Read In

8:31 AM Defendant Dustin L. Cote in court, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Russ S. Kort in court for Dustin L. Cote. 
Cases heard today are 22CF144, 22CF202, 22CF220 & 22CM104.

ADA Jambois calls the cases and states the appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
This is a joint/stipulated matter.  
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF144:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In

  
22CF202:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In
Count 2 - No contest 

22CF220:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In
Count 3 - No contest

22CM104:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 in 22CF144:  Possession of Methamphetamine 961.41(3g)(g), guilty of Count 2 in 22CF202:  Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty 943.201(2)(b), guilty of Count 1 in 22CF220:  Resisting or Obstructing an Officer 946.41(1) and guilty of Count 3 in 22CF220:  Bail Jumping - Felony 946.49(1)(b).
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
**Dismissed and Read In: 
Count 1 of 22CM104
Count 2 of 22CF220
Count 1 of 22CF202
Count 2 of 22CF144

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

ADA Jambois makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Kort makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant makes a brief statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
22CF144:
Count 1 -
Sentence Withheld
2 days of credit
Placed on Probation for a Period of 4 Years - concurrent with Count 3 in 22CF220 and Count 2 in 22CF202
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of probation in 22CF220 Count 3 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide DNA Sample 

22CF202:
Count 2 -
Sentence Withheld
Zero days of credit 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 4 Years - concurrent with Count 3 in 22CF220 and Count 2 of 22CF144
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of probation in 22CF220 Count 3 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide DNA Sample 

22CF220:
Count 1 -
Serve 120 days in the County Jail
Credit:  116 days
Time served sentence
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 3 -
Sentence Withheld
Zero days of credit
Placed on Probation for a Period of 4 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations or aftercare if he has already completed
Participate in any assessments, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
No contact with any victim, unless approved by the agent.
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide DNA Sample 

No restitution in any case is being claimed in any case
20 days to appeal

3:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Robert J Jambois in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dustin L. Cote in court, in custody.  Attorney Russ S. Kort in court for Dustin L. Cote. 
All files heard: 22CF144, 22CF202, 22CF220

Atty Jambois makes statements to the court and requests to adjourn these matters. The officer is not available to testify today due to training. 
Atty Kort makes statements.  They do intend to waive two of the preliminary hearings and go forward on 22CF220.  They did not waive and would request a dismissal. 
Atty Kort is provided a copy of the complaint in the possession case. 

22CF144 & 22CF202 - 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:02 p.m.  Defendant Dustin Cote appeared by video, in custody in Portage County.   Atty Robert Gardner appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutcher appeared in Court for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC/Methamphetamine/Narcotic Drugs - Second and Subsequent Offense.
Atty Gardner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty  does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
